00023 // global variable to determine auth status
00024 int AUTH_STATUS=1; // 0 if connected, any other number is an error
00025 
00026 //Create a global variable that will hold all the logger messages.
00027 char holder[100];
00028 //TO LOG ALL CLIENT CALLS, WE WILL SHARE a CLIENT FILE POINTER
00029 FILE *fpCLIENT = NULL;

00031 void* storage_connect(const char *hostname, const int port)
00032 {
00033         if(hostname == NULL)
00034         {
00035                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00036                 return NULL;
00037         }
00038         // Create a socket.
00039         int sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00040 
00041         
00042 
00043         if (sock < 0)
00044                 return NULL;
00045 
00046         // Get info about the server.
00047         struct addrinfo serveraddr, *res;
00048         memset(&serveraddr, 0, sizeof serveraddr);
00049         serveraddr.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
00050         serveraddr.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00051         char portstr[MAX_PORT_LEN];
00052         snprintf(portstr, sizeof portstr, "%d", port);
00053         int status = getaddrinfo(hostname, portstr, &serveraddr, &res);
00054 
00055         if (status != 0){
00056                 //CONNECTION FAILS, due to INVALID hostname/port
00057                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00058                 return NULL;
00059         }
00060 
00061         // Connect to the server.
00062         status = connect(sock, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen);
00063 
00064         if (status != 0)
00065                 {//CONNECTION FAILS SO ERROR.
00066                 errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00067                 return NULL;
00068 }
00079 
00080         if (fpCLIENT == NULL && LOGGING == 2)
00081         {
00082                         char str[200];
00083                         strcpy(str,"Client-");
00084                         strcat(str, currentDateTime());
00085                         strcat(str,".log");
00086                         fpCLIENT = fopen(str, "a");
00087         }
00088         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Client has successfully connected @ %s, socket number %d! \n", currentDateTime(),sock);
00089         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00091         
00092         //AUTH_STATUS = ERR_NOT_AUTHENTICATED; //Not sure why this is here...
00093         errno=0;
00094         return (void*) sock;
00095 }

00105 int storage_auth(const char *username, const char *passwd, void *conn)
00106 {
00107         //We have to handle commands that cannot be handled by the server.
00108         if (conn == NULL || username == NULL || passwd == NULL){
00109                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00110                 return -1;      
00111         }
00112         
00113         //CANNOT AUTH IF NOT CONNECTED!
00114         if(!conn)
00115         {
00116                 errno = ERR_CONNECTION_FAIL;
00117                 return -1;
00118         }
00119 
00120         //int auth_status=0; //WHAT IS THIS?
00121 
00122         // Connection is really just a socket file descriptor.
00123         int sock = (int)conn;
00124 
00125         // Send some data.
00126         char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00127         memset(buf, 0, sizeof buf);
00128 
00129         char *encrypted_passwd = generate_encrypted_password(passwd, NULL);
00130         
00131         snprintf(buf, sizeof buf, "AUTH %s %s\n", username, encrypted_passwd);
00132 
00133         // if sendall is zero, the value is sent to server successfully
00134         // if recvline is zero, the value is received succcessfully
00135 
00136         if (sendall(sock, buf, strlen(buf)) == 0 && recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) == 0) {
00137                 //auth_status = atoi(buf);
00138                 //errno=auth_status;
00139         
00140                 //Check if authentication successful!           
00141                 if (atoi(buf) == 0){
00142                         //NO ERROR, Send Success.
00143                         AUTH_STATUS = 0; 
00144                         errno = 0;                      
00145                         return 0; //success
00146                 }
00147                 else if (atoi(buf) == ERR_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED){
00148                         
00149                         //ERROR, Auth FAILED.                   
00150                         AUTH_STATUS = ERR_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED;
00151                         errno = ERR_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED;                      
00152                         return -1; //failure
00153                 }
00154                 
00155                 else{
00156                         errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00157                         return -1; //failure
00158                 }
00159 
00160         }
00161 
00162         
00163         //Should never get here, but if we do:
00164         errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00165         return -1;
00166 
00167 }

00174 int storage_get(const char *table, const char *key, struct storage_record *record, void *conn)
00175 {
00176         sprintf(holder, "[LOG]: Begin of GET-function [err:%d] \n",errno);
00177         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00178         
00179         
00180         // Checks if the conn has been made before allowing function get to be called
00181         if (table == NULL || key == NULL || conn == NULL)
00182         {
00183                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00184                 return -1;
00185         }
00186 
00187         //INVALID PARAMS TAKES PRIORITY BEFORE AUTH STATUS!
00188         sprintf(holder, "[LOG]PASSED THE CONNECTION IF \n");
00189         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00190 
00191         int tableCheck, keyCheck;
00192         tableCheck = valid_string_check(table,0);
00193         keyCheck = valid_string_check(key,0);
00194 
00195         if(tableCheck!=0 || keyCheck!=0 )
00196         {
00197                  errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00198                  return -1;
00199         }
00200         // *********************************************
00201 
00202         // Check if client has been authenticated
00203         if (AUTH_STATUS != 0){
00204                 errno = ERR_NOT_AUTHENTICATED;
00205                 return -1;      
00206         }
00207         
00208         // Connection is really just a socket file descriptor.
00209         int sock = (int)conn;
00210 
00211         // Send some data.
00212         char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00213         memset(buf, 0, sizeof buf);
00214         snprintf(buf, sizeof buf, "GET %s %s \n" , table, key);
00215 
00216         if (sendall(sock, buf, strlen(buf)) == 0 && recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) == 0) {
00217                
00218 
00219                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Database successfully returns table: %s and key: %s \n",table,key);
00220                 logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00221 
00222         int GET_STATUS;
00223         char CHAR_GET_STATUS[20];
00224         //To avoid the GET REQUEST value to not be cut off, we must 
00225                 
00226                 // The following line will start reading a number (%d) followed by anything until a new line(%[^\t\n]).
00227                 sscanf(buf,"%s %[^\n] \n",CHAR_GET_STATUS, record->value);
00228                 GET_STATUS = atoi(buf);
00229 
00230                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG2] GET STATUS: %d", GET_STATUS);
00231                 logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00232 
00233                 if(GET_STATUS==0){
00234                         errno = 0;
00235                         return 0; //SUCCESS
00236                 }
00237                 else{
00238                         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] VALUE IS: %s", record->value);
00239                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00240                         if (GET_STATUS == ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND){
00241                         errno = ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND;
00242                         return -1;
00243                         }
00244                         else if (GET_STATUS == ERR_KEY_NOT_FOUND){
00245                         errno = ERR_KEY_NOT_FOUND;
00246                         return -1;                      
00247                         }
00248                         
00249                 }
00250 
00251         }
00252         //SHOULD NEVER GET HERE, BUT IF SO:
00253         //Set special errno
00254         errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00255         return -1;
00256 }

00335

00337         int check_recvline = recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) ;

00340                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00341 
00342         if (check_sendall == 0 && check_recvline == 0) {
00343                 errno = atoi(buf);
00344                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] ERRNO in STORAGE_SET inside sendall/recv %d\n", errno);
00345                 logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00346                 if (errno == 0) //SUCCESS

00348                         return 0;
00349                 }
00350                 else{
00351                         return -1;

00353                 
00354         }
00355

00357

00359         //Send special error code:
00360         errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00361         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] ERRNO in STORAGE_SET outside sendall/recv %d\n", errno);
00362                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00363 
00364         return -1;
00365 }

00368 int storage_query(const char *table, const char *predicates, char **keys, const int max_keys, void *conn){
00369 
00370         if (table == NULL || predicates == NULL || conn == NULL) 
00371         {
00372                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00373                 return -1;
00374         }
00375 
00376         if (max_keys == 0){
00377         errno =0;
00378         keys == NULL;
00379         return 0;
00380         
00381         }
00382 
00383         int j;
00384         char **keys_temp = (char**)malloc(MAX_KEY_LEN*sizeof(char*));
00385 
00386                 for(j = 0; j < max_keys; j++)
00387                 {
00388                 keys_temp[j] = malloc(max_keys* sizeof(char));
00389                 }
00390 
00391         // Check if client has been authenticated
00392         if (AUTH_STATUS != 0){
00393                 errno = ERR_NOT_AUTHENTICATED;
00394                 return -1;      
00395         }
00396         int tableCheck; 
00397         
00398         // Check if table and key are alphanumeric
00399         // ===================================================
00400         tableCheck = valid_string_check(table,0);
00401         
00402         if(tableCheck!=0 )
00403         {
00404                  errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00405                  return -1;
00406         }       
00407 
00408         // Send some data(buf) into server.c
00409         // ================================================================
00410         // Connection is really just a socket file descriptor.
00411         int sock = (int)conn;
00412         int status;
00413         char buf[MAX_CMD_LEN];
00414         memset(buf, 0, sizeof buf);
00415         
00416         // Convert max_keys into string before sending into buff -> WHY?!
00417         char string1[20];           
00418         sprintf(string1,"%d",max_keys);
00419         
00420         // insert, table, key into the buffer
00421         //SEND IN THIS ORDER BECAUSE PREDICATES MAY HAVE SPACES.
00422         sprintf(buf, "QUERY %s %s %s \n", table, string1, predicates); //Why is there a \n ...
00423         
00424 
00425         //When we return we need some variables to set up the 2D array 'keys':
00426         int all_keys_length;
00427         char all_keys_string[1024]; //random size because we do not know how long the string can be.
00428         char errno_string[30]; //temporary errno value as a string
00429         char all_keys_length_string[30]; //temporary length of 1D keys value
00430 
00431 
00432         if (sendall(sock, buf, strlen(buf)) == 0 && recvline(sock, buf, sizeof buf) == 0) {
00433                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Before the SSCANF breakdown \n");
00434                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00435 
00436                 sscanf(buf,"%s %s %[^\n]\n",errno_string, all_keys_length_string, all_keys_string);
00437 
00438                 errno = atoi(errno_string);
00439                 all_keys_length= atoi(all_keys_length_string);
00440 
00441                 
00442                 sprintf(holder, "[LOG] After the SSCANF breakdown: %d %d %s \n", errno, all_keys_length, all_keys_string);
00443                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00444 
00445                 if (errno == ERR_TABLE_NOT_FOUND || errno == ERR_INVALID_PARAM){
00446                 return -1;              
00447                 }
00448                 
00449                 else{ //SUCCESS so errno is already 0 thus;
00450                 printf("SUCCESS \n");
00451 /*
00452                         //Allocating memory for a 2D array to store all keys matched from the server, called temp.
00453                         int k;
00454                         char **temp = (char**)malloc(MAX_KEY_LEN*sizeof(char*));
00455 
00456                         for(k = 0; k < all_keys_length; k++)
00457                         {
00458                         temp[k] = malloc(all_keys_length* sizeof(char));
00459                         }
00460 */
00461 
00462 char temp[800][800];
00463 
00464          int row=0, col=0, i=0;
00465         //use row to keep track of all the keys.
00466 
00467         //We must find the length of the 1D string called all_keys_string.
00468         int n = strlen(all_keys_string);
00469         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Size of string: %d \n", n);
00470                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00471 
00472                         //add counters
00473                          for(i=0; i<n; i++)
00474                          {
00475 
00476                            temp[row][col]=all_keys_string[i];
00477                         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Print the char transferred %c \n", temp[row][col]);
00478                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00479                            col++;
00480 
00481                            if(all_keys_string[i] == ' ')
00482                            {
00483                                 //temp[row][col]='\0';
00484                                  row++;
00485                                  col=0;
00486                            }
00487                          }
00488 
00489                          for (i=0; i<max_keys; i++){
00490 
00491                          strcpy(keys_temp[i], temp[i]);
00492 
00493                          sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Print the string transferred %s \n", keys_temp[i]);
00494                         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00495                         }
00496 
00497                         keys = keys_temp;
00498                 return all_keys_length;
00499             } //end of else - success
00500                 
00501         } // end of if for recv and sendall == 0
00502 
00503         //SHOULD NEVER GET HERE BUT IF SO:
00504         //SET ERROR;
00505         errno = ERR_UNKNOWN;
00506         return -1;
00507 }

00514 int storage_disconnect(void *conn)
00515 {
00516         // Cleanup
00517         // LOGGER 4!
00518         // ============================================================================
00519         if (fpCLIENT == NULL && LOGGING == 2)
00520         {
00521                 char str[200];
00522                 strcpy(str,"Client-");
00523                 strcat(str, currentDateTime());
00524                 strcat(str,".log");
00525                 fpCLIENT = fopen(str, "a");
00526         }
00527         // ============================================================================
00528 
00529         if(conn != NULL)
00530         {
00531                 int sock = (int)conn;
00532                 close(sock);
00533                 errno = 0;
00534         }
00535         else
00536         {
00537                 errno = ERR_INVALID_PARAM;
00538                 return -1;
00539         }
00540         // LOGGER 4!
00541         // REASONING: We must keep track of when the client connects and disconnects from the server. We must ensure that the socket closes properly
00542         // when they disconnect.
00543         sprintf(holder, "[LOG] Client has successfully disconnected @ time: %s \n",currentDateTime());
00544         logger(fpCLIENT,holder,LOGGING);
00545 
00546 
00547         return 0;
00548 
00549 }
